definitions: direction opposite to north, toward the bottom of standard maps
region located in the southern part of a country or area
examples: The compass needle points directly south toward magnetic poles
Birds migrate south to warmer climates during winter months
The American South has distinct cultural traditions and warm climate
Many retirees move south for the year-round sunshine and beaches

definitions: direction between south and east at forty-five degree angle
region located in the southeastern part of a country or continent
examples: The wind blows from the southeast during monsoon season
Ships sail southeast to reach the Indonesian archipelago from China
Southeast Asia attracts millions of tourists with tropical beaches and temples
The American Southeast includes states like Georgia and Florida

definitions: person who comes from or lives in the southern region of a country
examples: As a lifelong southerner, she spoke with a distinctive regional accent
Many southerners maintain strong connections to their cultural heritage and traditions

definitions: direction between south and west at forty-five degree angle
region located in the southwestern part of a country or continent
examples: The storm system moved southwest across the Pacific Ocean basin
Native Americans traveled southwest following seasonal migration routes of buffalo
The American Southwest features desert landscapes and adobe architecture styles
Airlines offer direct flights to major cities throughout the Southwest region

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the southwest region of a country
examples: The restaurant serves authentic southwestern cuisine with green chile and corn
Southwestern art features vibrant colors inspired by desert sunsets and landscapes

definitions: country in southwestern Europe on the Iberian Peninsula known for culture
examples: Spain attracts millions of tourists visiting Barcelona, Madrid, and coastal resorts
The economy of Spain relies heavily on tourism, agriculture, and manufacturing

definitions: unsolicited bulk electronic messages sent indiscriminately to many recipients
processed canned meat product made primarily from pork and ham
examples: Email filters automatically delete spam messages from unknown senders
Cybercriminals send spam containing malware links to steal personal information
Hawaii consumes more Spam per capita than any other American state
During World War II, Spam became a staple food for soldiers

definitions: native or inhabitant of Spain with Spanish nationality or heritage
examples: The famous Spaniard Pablo Picasso revolutionized modern art with cubism
Many Spaniards celebrate regional festivals like Running of the Bulls

definitions: Romance language originating in Spain spoken by millions worldwide
relating to Spain, its people, culture, or language
examples: Spanish ranks as the second most spoken language globally by native speakers
Students study Spanish to communicate with growing Hispanic populations worldwide
Spanish architecture features distinctive elements like tile roofs and courtyards
The Spanish civil war lasted from nineteen thirty-six to thirty-nine

definitions: small fiery particle thrown off from burning material or electrical discharge
thing that triggers or initiates an event, feeling, or process
examples: The welding torch threw sparks across the metal workshop floor
Static electricity created visible sparks when she touched the doorknob
Her innovative proposal provided the spark for company-wide digital transformation
A single spark of inspiration led to his breakthrough scientific discovery

definitions: ancient Greek city-state known for military prowess and austere lifestyle
examples: Sparta trained boys from age seven in rigorous military education programs
The rivalry between Athens and Sparta led to the Peloponnesian War

definitions: citizen or soldier of ancient Sparta known for discipline and courage
marked by simplicity, frugality, and avoidance of luxury or comfort
examples: The Spartan warriors fought with legendary courage at the Battle of Thermopylae
Young Spartan boys endured harsh training to become elite soldiers
The dormitory rooms featured spartan furnishings with only essential items
He maintained a spartan lifestyle despite his considerable wealth and success

definitions: person who speaks or delivers speeches to an audience
electroacoustic device that converts electrical signals into audible sound waves
presiding officer of a legislative assembly or parliament
examples: The keynote speaker captivated the conference audience for forty minutes
Native speakers provide authentic pronunciation models for language learners
The wireless speakers filled the room with crystal-clear surround sound
She upgraded her computer speakers for better audio quality
The Speaker of the House controls debate and maintains order during sessions
Parliament elected a new Speaker following the recent general election

definitions: mythical creature with human head and lion body in ancient mythology
ancient Egyptian stone statue, especially the Great Sphinx near pyramids
examples: The sphinx posed riddles to travelers in ancient Greek mythology
Egyptian art frequently depicts the sphinx as a guardian figure
The Great Sphinx of Giza stands twenty meters high near the pyramids
Archaeologists continue studying the Sphinx to determine its exact age

definitions: brightest star in the constellation Virgo and sixteenth brightest in night sky
examples: Astronomers use Spica as a navigation reference point in the southern sky
Spica appears blue-white and lies about two hundred fifty light-years away

definitions: division or separation into parts, especially a break or rupture
gymnastic position with legs extended in opposite directions
examples: The corporate split created two independent companies with different focuses
Their divorce resulted in an equal split of all marital assets
The gymnast performed a perfect split during her floor routine
Dancers practice splits daily to maintain flexibility and range

definitions: logical half-Vulcan science officer character from Star Trek television series
examples: Mr. Spock became an iconic character known for logic and raised eyebrow
Leonard Nimoy portrayed Spock in the original Star Trek series and films

definitions: Joseph Stalin, Soviet dictator who ruled from mid-1920s until 1953 death
examples: Stalin implemented collectivization policies that caused widespread famine in Ukraine
Under Stalin's rule, millions died in purges and forced labor camps

definitions: former name of Volgograd, site of decisive World War Two battle
examples: The Battle of Stalingrad marked a turning point in World War Two
Stalingrad endured months of devastating urban warfare during the Nazi siege

definitions: totalitarian political system and ideology associated with Joseph Stalin's Soviet rule
examples: Stalinism emphasized rapid industrialization through centralized economic planning and control
Critics of Stalinism point to mass repression and human rights violations

definitions: supporter or practitioner of Stalin's policies and totalitarian communist ideology
examples: Stalinist officials enforced collectivization despite widespread peasant resistance and famine
The Stalinist regime eliminated perceived enemies through show trials and executions

definitions: politically organized territory with sovereignty, especially within a federal system
particular condition or mode of being at a specific time
civil government and its administrative machinery as distinguished from citizens
examples: California became the thirty-first state to join the United States
Each state maintains its own constitution and legal system
The patient remains in a stable state following emergency surgery
Water exists in three states: solid, liquid, and gas
The state provides essential services including education and infrastructure
Separation of church and state remains a fundamental constitutional principle

definitions: building where a state legislature meets and conducts official government business
examples: Protesters gathered on the statehouse steps demanding education funding reforms
The historic statehouse features a golden dome visible throughout the capital

definitions: large mug, typically made of ceramic or glass, for drinking beer
German or Jewish surname, notably Gertrude Stein, American writer
examples: He collected decorative German beer steins from Oktoberfest celebrations
The ceramic stein held a full liter of traditional Bavarian beer
Gertrude Stein hosted famous literary salons in Paris during the 1920s
The Stein family emigrated from Germany in the nineteenth century

definitions: prestigious American piano manufacturing company known for concert grand pianos
examples: The concert hall's Steinway grand piano produces exceptionally rich tonal quality
Professional pianists often prefer Steinway pianos for important performances

definitions: rear part of a ship or boat opposite the bow
serious and unrelenting in demeanor, strict or severe in manner
examples: The captain stood at the stern watching the wake trail behind
Cargo was loaded through the stern doors of the ferry
The teacher's stern expression silenced the rowdy classroom immediately
His stern warning about safety prevented a serious accident

definitions: brand of wide-brimmed felt hat associated with American Western style
examples: The cowboy tipped his Stetson hat to greet the passing ladies
John B. Stetson created the iconic hat design in eighteen sixty-five

definitions: sharp organ used by insects and animals to inject venom
cocktail made with brandy and white cr√®me de menthe
portable surface-to-air missile system used by military forces
examples: The bee's stinger remained embedded in the skin after attack
Jellyfish stingers can cause painful welts lasting several hours
The bartender prepared a refreshing stinger with cognac and mint liqueur
Classic stingers were popular cocktails during the prohibition era
Military forces deployed Stinger missiles to defend against enemy aircraft
The shoulder-fired Stinger can target helicopters and low-flying planes

definitions: capital and largest city of Sweden, built on fourteen islands
examples: Stockholm hosts the annual Nobel Prize ceremonies every December tenth
The Stockholm archipelago contains approximately thirty thousand islands and skerries

definitions: adherent of Stoicism, ancient Greek philosophy emphasizing virtue and reason
person who endures hardship without showing feelings or complaint
examples: Ancient Stoics like Marcus Aurelius wrote influential philosophical texts
The Stoic philosophers taught that virtue leads to happiness
She remained stoic throughout the painful medical procedures
His stoic acceptance of misfortune impressed everyone around him

definitions: ancient Greek philosophy teaching virtue, reason, and living according to nature
quality of enduring pain or hardship without displaying feelings
examples: Stoicism influenced Roman emperors and modern cognitive behavioral therapy
The principles of Stoicism emphasize wisdom, justice, courage, and temperance
Her stoicism during the crisis provided strength to others
Professional athletes often display stoicism when facing injury

definitions: person who tends furnaces, especially on steamships or locomotives
surname, notably Bram Stoker who wrote the novel Dracula
examples: The ship's stoker shoveled coal into the furnaces throughout the voyage
Railway stokers worked in extreme heat keeping steam engines running
Bram Stoker created the iconic vampire character Count Dracula
The Stoker family moved from Ireland to London in the 1870s

definitions: hard solid mineral matter, especially as building material
British unit of weight equal to fourteen pounds
hard mass formed in kidney, gallbladder, or other organs
examples: The ancient castle walls were built from local limestone blocks
Precious stones like diamonds form under extreme pressure underground
The wrestler weighed fifteen stone before the championship match
British people often measure body weight in stones and pounds
The kidney stone caused severe pain requiring emergency medical treatment
Gallbladder stones can block bile ducts and cause inflammation

definitions: prehistoric stone circle monument in Wiltshire, England, built around 3000 BCE
examples: Stonehenge attracts over one million visitors annually to witness ancient mysteries
Archaeologists debate whether Stonehenge served as temple, observatory, or burial ground

definitions: single thin length of thread, fiber, hair, or similar material
beach or shore, especially at water's edge
leave someone without means of transport or in difficulty
examples: DNA consists of two strands twisted together in double helix structure
She wove multiple strands of yarn to create colorful patterns
Children built sandcastles along the sunny strand near the pier
The strand stretched for miles along the coastal region
The cancelled flight stranded hundreds of passengers at the airport
Car trouble stranded them in the desert without cell service

definitions: trademarked brand of expanded polystyrene foam used for insulation and packaging
examples: Styrofoam cups keep beverages hot but create environmental waste problems
The fragile electronics arrived safely packed in protective Styrofoam blocks

definitions: river in Greek mythology forming boundary between Earth and underworld
examples: Ancient Greeks believed souls crossed the river Styx to reach Hades
Achilles gained invulnerability when dipped in the river Styx

definitions: country in northeastern Africa, formerly largest African nation before South Sudan independence
examples: Sudan's capital Khartoum sits at the confluence of Blue and White Nile
The conflict in Sudan has created one of the world's worst humanitarian crises

definitions: person from Sudan or relating to Sudan and its people
examples: Sudanese refugees fled violence seeking safety in neighboring countries
Traditional Sudanese cuisine features dishes like ful medames and kisra bread

definitions: Egyptian city and canal connecting Mediterranean Sea to Red Sea
examples: The Suez Canal handles roughly twelve percent of global trade traffic
The Suez Crisis of 1956 involved Egypt, Israel, Britain, and France

definitions: practitioner of Sufism, the mystical dimension of Islamic spirituality
examples: The Sufi poet Rumi wrote verses about divine love and unity
Sufi whirling dervishes perform meditative spinning as spiritual practice

definitions: mystical Islamic belief system emphasizing direct personal experience of divine
examples: Sufism emphasizes inner purification and direct knowledge of God through meditation
The teachings of Sufism spread throughout the Islamic world via orders

definitions: large island in western Indonesia known for rainforests and volcanic activity
examples: Sumatra contains some of the last habitats for endangered Sumatran tigers
The 2004 tsunami devastated coastal communities throughout northern Sumatra

definitions: relating to Sumatra island or person from Sumatra in Indonesia
examples: Sumatran coffee beans produce distinctively earthy and herbal flavor profiles
The Sumatran rhinoceros remains critically endangered with fewer than eighty surviving

definitions: earliest known civilization in southern Mesopotamia, flourishing around 4500-1900 BCE
examples: Sumer developed the first known writing system using cuneiform script
The city-states of Sumer included Ur, Uruk, and Eridu

definitions: member of ancient Sumer civilization in southern Mesopotamia
extinct language of ancient Sumer, earliest known written language
examples: Sumerian farmers developed sophisticated irrigation systems for agriculture
The Sumerian king Gilgamesh became subject of humanity's oldest epic
Sumerian cuneiform tablets provide insights into ancient administrative practices
Scholars study Sumerian texts to understand early human civilization

definitions: star at center of solar system providing light and heat to Earth
common name for newspapers, especially tabloid publications
examples: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west daily
Plants convert sun energy into food through photosynthesis process
The Sun newspaper covers celebrity gossip and sensational stories
She reads The Sun every morning with her coffee

definitions: first day of the week in many cultures, traditionally observed as day of rest
examples: Many families gather for Sunday dinner after attending religious services
The museum offers free admission every Sunday to local residents

definitions: member of the larger of two main branches of Islam
examples: Sunni Muslims comprise approximately eighty-five percent of global Muslim population
The Sunni tradition recognizes the first four caliphs as legitimate successors

definitions: US federal program to clean up sites contaminated with hazardous substances
examples: The Superfund program has cleaned hundreds of toxic waste sites nationwide
Congress established Superfund legislation following the Love Canal disaster
